properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 8 at 4:15AM PST until January 9 at 6:58AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...Flood Warnings continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County
Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston
Counties
Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County

No hydrologically significant precipitation in the forecast for the
next two days. Another front will arrive on Friday but snow levels
will be low, below 2000 feet, keeping the precipitation in the
form of snow in the mountains limiting runoff into the rivers.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Chehalis River Above Grand Mound
* Until Thursday morning.
* At  4:00 AM Wednesday the stage was 142.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 141.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river crested at 142.4 feet at 4 AM Wednesday and
will continue to fall to below flood stage tonight.
* Impact...At 141.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will
flood several roads in Independence Valley including James Road...
Independence Road and Moon road. Flood waters will also cover
nearby farm lands.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until Thursday morning
